definitions.definition: the condition of being unable to stop using or doing something as a habit, especially something harmful
definitions.labels: (British English)(informal)(British English)(North American English)(British English)(British English)(British English)(British English)(North American English)(British English)(North American English)(British English)(British English)(British English)(North American English)(British English)(British English)

examples.text: He is now fighting his addiction to alcohol.
an addiction to TV game shows/social media/gambling
She stole money from her parents to feed her addiction.
He was struggling to beat his heroin addiction.
She had an addiction to heroin.

wordOrigin: late 16th cent. (denoting a person's inclination): from Latin addictio(n-), from addicere ‘assign’, from ad- ‘to’ + dicere ‘say’.
